Token.Abstract: The RKObjectManager class provides a centralized interface for performing object mapping based HTTP request and response operations. It encapsulates common configuration such as request/response descriptors and routing, provides for the creation of NSURLRequest and RKObjectRequestOperation objects, and one-line methods to enqueue object request operations for the basic HTTP request methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc).
Return the shared instance of the object manager
Set the shared instance of the object manager

Parameter.Name: manager
Parameter.Abstract: The new shared manager instance.

Token.Abstract: Creates and returns a new RKObjectManager object initialized with a new AFHTTPClient object that was in turn initialized with the given base URL. The RestKit defaults are applied to the object manager.

Parameter.Name: baseURL
Parameter.Abstract: The base URL with which to initialize the AFHTTPClient object

ReturnValue.Abstract: A new RKObjectManager initialized with an AFHTTPClient that was initialized with the given baseURL.

Token.Abstract: Initializes the receiver with the given AFNetworking HTTP client object, adopting the network configuration from the client.

Parameter.Name: client
Parameter.Abstract: The AFNetworking HTTP client with which to initialize the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the given client.

Token.Abstract: The AFNetworking HTTP client with which the receiver makes requests.
The AFNetworking HTTP client with which the receiver makes requests.
The base URL of the underlying HTTP client.
The base URL of the underlying HTTP client.
The default HTTP headers for all NSURLRequest objects constructed by the object manager.
The default HTTP headers for all NSURLRequest objects constructed by the object manager.
The operation queue which manages operations enqueued by the object manager.
The operation queue which manages operations enqueued by the object manager.
The router used to generate URL objects for routable requests created by the manager.
The router used to generate URL objects for routable requests created by the manager.
The MIME Type to serialize request parameters into when constructing request objects.
The MIME Type to serialize request parameters into when constructing request objects.
The value for the HTTP "Accept" header to specify the preferred serialization format for retrieved data.

Parameter.Name: MIMEType
Parameter.Abstract: The MIME Type to set as the value for the HTTP "Accept" header.

Token.Abstract: Creates and returns an NSMutableURLRequest object with a given object, method, path, and parameters.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object with which to construct the request. For the POST, PUT, and PATCH request methods, the object will parameterized using the RKRequestDescriptor for the object.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method for the request, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL. If nil, the router is consulted.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be either set as a query string for GET requests, or reverse merged with the parameterization of the object and set as the request HTTP body.

Token.Abstract: Creates an NSMutableURLRequest object with the specified HTTP method and path, and constructs a multipart/form-data HTTP body, using the specified parameters and multipart form data block. See http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/interact/forms.html#h-17.13.4.2
Token.Declaration: - (NSMutableURLRequest *)multipartFormRequestWithObject:(id)object method:(RKRequestMethod)method path:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters constructingBodyWithBlock:(void ( ^ ) ( id<AFMultipartFormData> formData ))block

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object with which to construct the request. For the POST, PUT, and PATCH request methods, the object will parameterized using the RKRequestDescriptor for the object.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method for the request, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL. If nil, the router is consulted.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be either set as a query string for GET requests, or reverse merged with the parameterization of the object and set as the request HTTP body.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block that takes a single argument and appends data to the HTTP body. The block argument is an object adopting the AFMultipartFormData protocol. This can be used to upload files, encode HTTP body as JSON or XML, or specify multiple values for the same parameter, as one might for array values.

Token.Abstract: Creates an NSMutableURLRequest object with the NSURL returned by the router for the given route name and object and the given parameters.

Parameter.Name: routeName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the route object containing the path pattern which is to be interpolated against the given object, appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object with which to interpolate the path pattern of the named route. Can be nil.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be either set as a query string for GET requests, or the request HTTP body.

Token.Abstract: Creates an NSMutableURLRequest object with the NSURL returned by the router for the relationship of the given object and the given parameters.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object for which related objects are being loaded. Evaluated against the RKRoute for the relationship for the object's class with the given name to compute the path. Cannot be nil.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method for the request.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL, or parameterized and set as the request body. May be nil.

Parameter.Name: relationshipName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the relationship being loaded. Used to retrieve the RKRoute object from the router for the given object's class and the relationship name. Cannot be nil.

ReturnValue.Abstract:
An NSMutableURLRequest object for the specified relationship.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if no route is configured for a relationship of the given object's class with the given name.

Token.Abstract: Sets the RKHTTPRequestOperation subclass to be used when constructing HTTP request operations for requests dispatched through the manager.

Parameter.Name: operationClass
Parameter.Abstract: A class object inheriting from RKHTTPRequestOperation to be used for HTTP requests dispatched through the manager. @raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if the given class does not inherit from RKHTTPRequestOperation.

Token.Abstract: Creates an RKObjectRequestOperation operation with the given request and sets the completion block with the given success and failure blocks.
Token.Declaration: - (RKObjectRequestOperation *)objectRequestOperationWithRequest:(NSURLRequest *)request success:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , RKMappingResult *mappingResult ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: The request object to be loaded asynchronously during execution of the operation.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created object request operation and the RKMappingResult object created by object mapping the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the resonse data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An RKObjectRequestOperation object that is ready to be sent.

Token.Abstract: Creates an RKManagedObjectRequestOperation operation with the given request and managed object context, and sets the completion block with the given success and failure blocks.
Token.Declaration: - (RKManagedObjectRequestOperation *)managedObjectRequestOperationWithRequest:(NSURLRequest *)request managedObjectContext:(NSManagedObjectContext *)managedObjectContext success:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , RKMappingResult *mappingResult ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: request
Parameter.Abstract: The request object to be loaded asynchronously during execution of the operation.

Parameter.Name: managedObjectContext
Parameter.Abstract: The managed object context with which to associate the operation. This context will be used as the parent context of a new operation local NSManagedObjectContext with the NSPrivateQueueConcurrencyType concurrency type. Upon success, the private context will be saved and changes resulting from the object mapping will be 'pushed' to the given context.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created object request operation and the RKMappingResult object created by object mapping the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the resonse data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An RKObjectRequestOperation object that is ready to be sent.

Token.Abstract: Creates and returns an object request operation of the appropriate type for the given object, request method, path, and parameters.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object with which to construct the object request operation. May be nil.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The request method for the request.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's baseURL and set as the URL of the request. If nil, the router is consulted.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be either set as a query string for GET requests, or reverse merged with the parameterization of the object and set as the request HTTP body.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A newly created RKObjectRequestOperation or RKManagedObjectRequest operation as deemed appropriate by the manager for the given parameters.

Token.Abstract: Enqueues an RKObjectRequestOperation to the object manager's operation queue.

Parameter.Name: objectRequestOperation
Parameter.Abstract: The object request operation to be enqueued.

Token.Abstract: Cancels all operations in the object manager's operation queue whose requests match the specified HTTP method and path pattern.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method to match for the cancelled requests, such as RKRequestMethodGET, RKRequestMethodPOST, RKRequestMethodPUT, RKRequestMethodPatch, or RKRequestMethodDELETE. If RKRequestMethodAny, all object request operations with URLs matching the given path pattern will be cancelled.

Parameter.Name: pathPattern
Parameter.Abstract: The pattern to match against the path of the request URL for executing object request operations considered for cancellation.

Token.Abstract: Creates and enqueues an RKObjectRequestOperation to the object manager's operation queue for each specified object into a batch. Each object request operation is built by evaluating the object against the given route to construct a request path and then invoking appropriateObjectRequestOperationWithObject:method:path:parameters:. When each object request operation finishes, the specified progress block is executed, until all of the request operations have finished, at which point the completion block also executes.
Token.Declaration: - (void)enqueueBatchOfObjectRequestOperationsWithRoute:(RKRoute *)route objects:(NSArray *)objects progress:(void ( ^ ) ( NSUInteger numberOfFinishedOperations , NSUInteger totalNumberOfOperations ))progress completion:(void ( ^ ) ( NSArray *operations ))completion

Parameter.Name: route
Parameter.Abstract: The route specifying the request method and the path pattern with which to construct the request for each object object request operation in the batch.

Parameter.Name: objects
Parameter.Abstract: The set of objects for which to enqueue a batch of object request operations.

Parameter.Name: progress
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when an object request operation completes. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the number of finished operations and the total number of operations initially executed.

Parameter.Name: completion
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the object request operations complete. This block has no return value and takes one argument: the list of operations executed.

Token.Abstract: Enqueues a set of RKObjectRequestOperation to the object manager's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)enqueueBatchOfObjectRequestOperations:(NSArray *)operations progress:(void ( ^ ) ( NSUInteger numberOfFinishedOperations , NSUInteger totalNumberOfOperations ))progress completion:(void ( ^ ) ( NSArray *operations ))completion

Parameter.Name: operations
Parameter.Abstract: The set of object request operations to be enqueued.

Parameter.Name: progress
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when an object request operation completes. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the number of finished operations and the total number of operations initially executed.

Parameter.Name: completion
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the object request operations complete. This block has no return value and takes one argument: the list of operations executed.

Token.Abstract: Creates an RKObjectRequestOperation with a GET request with a URL for the given path, and enqueues it to the manager's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getObjectsAtPath:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , RKMappingResult *mappingResult ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the object request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created object request operation and the RKMappingResult object created by object mapping the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the resonse data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Token.Abstract: Creates an RKObjectRequestOperation with a GET request for the relationship with the given name of the given object, and enqueues it to the manager's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getObjectsAtPathForRelationship:(NSString *)relationshipName ofObject:(id)object parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , RKMappingResult *mappingResult ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: relationshipName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the relationship being loaded. Used to retrieve the RKRoute object from the router for the given object's class and the relationship name. Cannot be nil.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object for which related objects are being loaded. Evaluated against the RKRoute for the relationship for the object's class with the given name to compute the path. Cannot be nil.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL. May be nil.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the object request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created object request operation and the mapped result created from object mapping the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract:
A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the resonse data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if no route is configured for a relationship of the given object's class with the given name.

Token.Abstract: Creates an RKObjectRequestOperation with a GET request for the URL returned by the router for the given route name, and enqueues it to the manager's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getObjectsAtPathForRouteNamed:(NSString *)routeName object:(id)object parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , RKMappingResult *mappingResult ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: routeName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the route being loaded. Used to retrieve the RKRoute object from the router with the given name. Cannot be nil.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object to be interpolated against the path pattern of the RKRoute object retrieved with the given name. Used to compute the path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL. May be nil.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL. May be nil.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the object request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created object request operation and the mapped result created from object mapping the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract:
A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the resonse data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if no route is configured with the given name or the route returned specifies an HTTP method other than GET.

Token.Abstract: Creates an RKObjectRequestOperation with a GET request for the given object, and enqueues it to the manager's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getObject:(id)object path:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , RKMappingResult *mappingResult ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( RKObjectRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The object with which to construct the object request operation. Cannot be nil.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL. If nil, the request URL will be obtained by consulting the router for a route registered for the given object's class and the RKRequestMethodGET request method.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the object request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created object request operation and the RKMappingResult object created by object mapping the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the resonse data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Parameter.Name: object

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL. If nil, the request URL will be obtained by consulting the router for a route registered for the given object's class and the RKRequestMethodPOST method.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be reverse merged with the parameterization of the given object and set as the request body.

Parameter.Name: success

This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Token.Abstract: Returns an array containing the RKRequestDescriptor objects added to the manager.

Token.Abstract: A Core Data backed object store for persisting objects that have been fetched from the Web

An array of RKFetchRequestBlock blocks used to map NSURL objects into corresponding NSFetchRequest objects.
An array of RKFetchRequestBlock blocks used to map NSURL objects into corresponding NSFetchRequest objects.
Adds the given RKFetchRequestBlock block to the manager.

Parameter.Name: A
Parameter.Abstract: block object to be executed when constructing an NSFetchRequest object from a given NSURL. The block has a return type of NSFetchRequest and accepts a single NSURL argument.
